definition: to send out/to show (one's feeling)/to issue/to develop/to make a bundle of money/classifier for gunshots (rounds)
to tremble/to shiver/to shake/to vibrate/Taiwan pr. [zhan4]

sentences.english: His high notes quavered when he sang the “Internationale”.
sentences.chinese: 他唱《國際歌》時高音發顫。

sentences.english: When Saul saw the army of the Philistines, he was afraid, and his heart trembled greatly.
sentences.chinese: 掃羅看見非利士的軍旅就懼怕，心中發顫。

sentences.english: This is a letter with a trill.
Her voice quivered as she spoke.
I'm so tired that my knees are shaking.
sentences.chinese: 我實在是太累了，我的膝蓋都在發顫了。

sentences.english: Dad's lower jaw trembled as he stared at the uplifted paw.
sentences.chinese: 爸爸注視着那隻伸出來的爪子，下巴發顫。

sentences.english: In the lonely darkness he shivered with fright.
sentences.chinese: 他在毫無聲息的黑暗裏怕得全身發顫。

sentences.english: The Shu aroma once connects gold card, the jade hand trembles, or had some to challenge not trust.
sentences.chinese: 淑芬接過金卡，玉手發顫，還是有些不敢相信。

sentences.english: His voice quivered and he paused to steady it.
sentences.chinese: 他的聲音發顫，於是停頓幾秒來平復一下。

definition: the second person/(fig.) someone else/third party
lit. cannot rest or eat in peace (idiom)/fig. extremely worried and troubled
vocal accompaniment in some traditional Chinese operas/to speak in support of/to chime in
lit. as if sitting on pins and needles (idiom)/fig. to be in an uncomfortable situation
lit. crow and peacock make no sound/absolute silence (idiom); not a single voice can be heard/absolute silence
open the net on one side (idiom); let the caged bird fly/to give one's opponent a way out/lenient treatment
